common_issues.title: PiecesOS Long Term Memory High CPU Usage
common_issues.description: PiecesOS users report high CPU usage and slow performance when Long Term Memory (LTM) is enabled, especially on Windows with apps like Slack and Discord.  Disabling LTM, updating to LTM2, or switching to Cloud processing mode offered partial improvements. The Pieces team is actively investigating and releasing updates to address the issue.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Conversation Summary

**Problem:** High CPU usage in PiecesOS, particularly with LTM2 enabled. 

**Key points:**

* Users reported consistently high CPU usage, especially on Windows 10/11 and with Microsoft Edge open. 
* The problem seemed to be related to LTM2, as disabling it improved performance.
* One user experienced a significant improvement after updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2 runtime.
* Another user found that moving folders from NTFS to ReFS improved performance, suggesting a possible issue with file access.

**Solutions:**

* **Initial hotfix:** Improved performance but still experienced occasional hiccups.
* **Subsequent patch:** Further improvement but still not fully resolved.
* **Microsoft Edge update:** Resolved high CPU usage for one user, suggesting a possible Edge-related issue.
* **Folder relocation:** Resolved issues for another user, suggesting a potential problem with file access on NTFS drives.

**Current status:**

* The Pieces team continues to investigate the issue and promised further fixes in the following week.
* Some users have found workarounds that improve performance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

### Key points raised:

* Pieces OS consumes high RAM and CPU, even when not in active use. This impacted users' system performance.
* Users reported RAM usage up to 5GB, with CPU spikes exceeding 100% in some cases.
* Speculation arose that the high resource consumption could be due to data mining by Pieces.

### Problems identified:

* High RAM and CPU utilization by PiecesOS significantly impacting user system performance.
* Memory leaks suspected due to consistently high memory usage.

### Solutions proposed/implemented:

* Developers replaced heavy database technologies in version 11.1.0 to address potential memory and CPU issues.
* Users advised to use the "Optimize Memory" function to free up resources.
* Developers actively working on further improvements for future releases.

### Current status/outcome:

* Version 11.1.0 release reported to improve CPU usage for some users but not all. 
* High resource usage persists for some, impacting system performance.
* Users request a "lite" mode with reduced functionality for lower resource usage. 
* Developers acknowledged the ongoing issue and continue investigating solutions for further improvement in upcoming releases.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Pieces for Developers Cannot Connect to Pieces OS"

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi is unable to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a recent Pieces OS update.
* MoyinShabi did not receive any health check notifications on their desktop.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issues with MoyinShabi's desktop app database.
* The "PiecesOS" folder's "Pieces" folder is causing issues.
* An error with the GetIt flutter package not finding a specific dependency.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces shared a repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder to replace MoyinShabi's existing one.
* No solution was implemented for the "Pieces" folder issue or the GetIt error.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* MoyinShabi is still experiencing the connection issue after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* The root cause of the problem remains unidentified.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests that mack-at-pieces may be working on a solution for the remaining issues.
* MoyinShabi provided detailed information and logs, which will likely be helpful in troubleshooting the problem.

**Next Steps:**

* mack-at-pieces needs to investigate the remaining issues and propose further solutions.
* MoyinShabi should continue to provide feedback and information to help diagnose the problem.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

* User `hikineet98` reported an issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
